bug.author: Khoa-NT
bug.summary: [TF 2.0 alpha] Tutorial "Loading Data" wrong link path
bug.description:
Please make sure that this is a documentation issue. As per our GitHub Policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests and build/installation issues on GitHub. tag:doc_template System information
TensorFlow version: Tensorflow 2.0 alpha Doc Link: Load images with tf.data Using TFRecords and tf.Example
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/alpha/tutorials/load_data/images>Load images with tf.data</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/alpha/tutorials/load_data/tf_records>Using TFRecords and tf.Example</denchmark-link> have wrong links to Colab and github. They should link to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/r2/tutorials/load_data/images.ipynb>https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/r2/tutorials/load_data/images.ipynb</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/r2/tutorials/load_data/tf_records.ipynb>https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/r2/tutorials/load_data/tf_records.ipynb</denchmark-link>
We welcome contributions by users. Will you be able to update submit a PR (use the doc style guide) to fix the doc Issue?

comments.comment: @shaolinkhoa The issue has been updated and commits are approved. You can close this issue. Thank you for letting us know :)
Closing this issue since its resolved. Thanks all.
